text: Q.18 Which of the following is true? ° The set of all formal languages is countably infinite. Your answer is Correct Solution : (a) (a) The set of all formal languages is countably infinite because it is enumerable. (b) It is UCL (Uncountably infinite) (c) Set of all languages is UCI because it is 2* and it cannot be enumerated. (d) It is CSL not context free. e The set of all irrational numbers is countably infinite. ° The set of all languages is countably infinite. Q L ={ww|w e (a+ b)*} is context free language.
